alert.note: Alert for Allen; Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 12:56AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elk, Wilson, northwestern Labette, Neosho, Montgomery, Chautauqua, southeastern Woodson and Allen Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1255 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Moran to 5 miles west of Thayer to 10 miles southwest of Chautauqua. Movement was to the east-northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Independence, Chanute, Iola, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Humboldt, Erie, Sedan, St. Paul, La Harpe, Gas, Moran, Thayer, Altoona, Longton, Elk City, Buffalo and Peru. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson
